moves.2... dxc4: Still book, but a dangerous move, since it leaves the center to white.
moves.3... e5: Another thematic move, leading to a sharp game.
moves.5. Bxc4: Leaves e4 to black, but at a cost.
moves.5... Bb4+: Interposing a check for developement's sake.
moves.6. Bd2: Somewhat unexpected to me, but of course white cares for developement, without leaving black the extra tempo we will have if Nc3.
moves.7. Nbxd2: e4 is defended, and three minor pieces are developed against one by black. It leaves d4 to black, though.
moves.8. e5: Putting the question to the black knight.
moves.8... Ng4: Alternate moves were: Nd7, Nh5, or Qe7.
moves.9... Nh6: The knight retires to the only possible square.
moves.10. Nb3: Attacking d4. Compare white's to black's position...
moves.10... c5: Confidently, since if Nxc5, Qa5+, winning the knight.
moves.11. Qe2: With threats on the e column.
moves.12. Rc1: Now the c5 pawn can be taken. If the queen checks and takes the white knight, Bxf7+ and RxQ.
moves.12... Nd7: A manouvre that intends to develop the lsb on g7 while defending c5.
moves.13. Bd3: Blocks the d pawn, attacks c5 and points to h7.
moves.13... Re8: Trying to take advantage of the Q/K line. I cannot remember what we thought about the c5 pawn.
moves.14. O-O: Shielding the king and releasing the potential pin.
moves.14... Qe7: Piling up against the e pawn.
moves.15... g6: Defending h7 and preparing a possible return of the h6 knight into the game.
moves.16. Qe4: Occupying a central square, avoiding the necessary b6.
moves.17. Qf4: A covered fork on Nh6 and Rb8.
moves.17... Nf5: Preferring to open the king's position instead of defending the knight.
moves.20. Nxc5: The d7 knight is stuck to the defence of Rb8, so white can take c5.
moves.21... Bd7: Putting the question to the queen and finally moving the lsb.
moves.22. Qg3+: A check that allows white to win another tempo.
moves.22... Kf8: Considered better than Kh8 due to Qe5+, winning the knight.
moves.23... Ne4: Mixing up things. It shields the d6 pawn.
moves.24... Kg8: We were at a loss, so easy played the best possible move.
moves.26. Qg3+: Check again to free the R/N action on d6.
moves.26... Kh8: Kf8 or Kf7 had their counters, too.

gameName: - Masterclass  QGA - Master vs Walkers & Talkers
